item.title: EncodeRec: An Embedding Backbone for Recommendation Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.10837v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent recommender systems increasingly leverage embeddings from large pre-trained language models (PLMs). However, such embeddings exhibit two key limitations: (1) PLMs are not explicitly optimized to produce structured and discriminative embedding s...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> experiment, embedding, RAG, arxiv, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Building AI Agents to Improve Job Referral Requests to Strangers
item.description: arXiv:2601.10726v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper develops AI agents that help job seekers write effective requests for job referrals in a professional online community. The basic workflow consists of an improver agent that rewrites the referral request and an evaluator agent that measures...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> experiment, RAG, LLM, large language model, vision | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> reasoning, RAG, vector, LLM, framework | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
